actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Fry asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Thursday, June 16, 2023, it adjourn to meet at noon on Tuesday, June 20, 2023, for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Fry asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 2:00 p.m. on June 16. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 220
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 210

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 288 — "To amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify the nature of judicial review of agency interpretations of statutory and regulatory provisions."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motion to recommit H.R. 288 and passage of the bill, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 288, the Chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Dean (PA) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Dean (PA) moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
The previous question was ordered on the amendment and the bill pursuant to the rule.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 495, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 1.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 1 printed in Part B of House Report 118-108 to subject interpretative rules, general statements of policy, and all other agency guidance to de novo judicial review.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 288.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 44, H.R. 277, H.R. 288, H.R. 1615 and H.R. 1640. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 44 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate and H.R. 277, H.R. 288, H.R. 1615, and H.R. 1640 under structured rules with one hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed on each measure. The resolution also provides that the ordering of the yeas and nays on the question of reconsideration of the vote on adoption of H. Res. 463 be considered vacated and the motion to reconsider be laid on the table.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 495. H.R. 288 — "To amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify the nature of judicial review of agency interpretations of statutory and regulatory provisions."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to five per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Davis of IL to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Deacon Dan S. Borné, Diocese of Baton Rouge, Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
